item.title: Wrong slots?
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

There should be an array for each slot, most commonly in a class called “wieldable, itemAssistant, playerAssistant”, something of that nature depending on your source.

Read full topic

item.title: Wrong slots?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

I do know what i’m doing, I just never handled something like this. Also, these codes are all server-sided.

How would I define the slots? Don’t spoonfeed it 100% just a little hint.

Read full topic

item.title: Wrong slots?
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

Item wielding is handled server sided, and not client sided. So he didnt add an anti-leech, you just have no idea what you are doing. Any item not in the cache you are using needs to have its slots defined.

Read full topic

item.title: Wrong slots?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Well, I’m using Demise’s client because it’s unique and kinda awesome. I think he added an anti-leech because some customs go into the wrong slot, like claws, and weapons. They all go to the hat slot. In Item.java there are strings for hats, boots, gloves, shields, platebody, amulets, and arrows. So i had to add another string pertaining only to claws atm until I can get it working.

Then in ItemAssistant.java
It didn’t have weapon, so i added it.

for (int i=0; i< Item.legs.length;i++) { if(item == Item.legs[i]) return "legs"; } for (int i=0; i< Item.weapon.length;i++) { if(item == Item.weapon[i]) return "weapon"; } return "weapon"; }

Read full topic
